question_text:
Question 27 
 
Consider a steam power plant operating on an ideal reheat Rankine cycle. The work input to the 
pump is  
20kJ/kg.
 The work output from the high pressure turbine is 750 kJ/kg. The work output
from the low pressure turbine is 1500 kJ/kg. The thermal efficiency of the cycle is 50%. The 
enthalpy of saturated liquid and saturated vapour at condenser pressure are 200 kJ/kg and 2600 
kJ/kg, respectively. The quality of steam at the exit of the low pressure turbine is _______ %(round 
off to the nearest integer).
Application of Thermodynamics (Power Plant) 
Ans. 
92.91 
Sol.
